00029 void system_init() 
00030 {
00031   PINOUT_DDR &= ~(PINOUT_MASK); // Configure as input pins
00032   PINOUT_PORT |= PINOUT_MASK;   // Enable internal pull-up resistors. Normal high operation.
00033   PINOUT_PCMSK |= PINOUT_MASK;  // Enable specific pins of the Pin Change Interrupt
00034   PCICR |= (1 << PINOUT_INT);   // Enable Pin Change Interrupt
00035 }
00036 
00037 
00038 // Pin change interrupt for pin-out commands, i.e. cycle start, feed hold, and reset. Sets
00039 // only the runtime command execute variable to have the main program execute these when 
00040 // its ready. This works exactly like the character-based runtime commands when picked off
00041 // directly from the incoming serial data stream.
00042 ISR(PINOUT_INT_vect) 
00043 {
00044   // Enter only if any pinout pin is actively low.
00045   if ((PINOUT_PIN & PINOUT_MASK) ^ PINOUT_MASK) { 
00046     if (bit_isfalse(PINOUT_PIN,bit(PIN_RESET))) {
00047       mc_reset();
00048     } else if (bit_isfalse(PINOUT_PIN,bit(PIN_FEED_HOLD))) {
00049       sys.execute |= EXEC_FEED_HOLD; 
00050     } else if (bit_isfalse(PINOUT_PIN,bit(PIN_CYCLE_START))) {
00051       sys.execute |= EXEC_CYCLE_START;
00052     } 
00053   }
00054 }

00057 // Executes user startup script, if stored.
00058 void system_execute_startup(char *line) 
00059 {
00060   uint8_t n;
00061   for (n=0; n < N_STARTUP_LINE; n++) {
00062     if (!(settings_read_startup_line(n, line))) {
00063       report_status_message(STATUS_SETTING_READ_FAIL);
00064     } else {
00065       if (line[0] != 0) {
00066         printString(line); // Echo startup line to indicate execution.
00067         report_status_message(gc_execute_line(line));
00068       }
00069     } 
00070   }  
00071 }

00074 // Directs and executes one line of formatted input from protocol_process. While mostly
00075 // incoming streaming g-code blocks, this also executes Grbl internal commands, such as 
00076 // settings, initiating the homing cycle, and toggling switch states. This differs from
00077 // the runtime command module by being susceptible to when Grbl is ready to execute the 
00078 // next line during a cycle, so for switches like block delete, the switch only effects
00079 // the lines that are processed afterward, not necessarily real-time during a cycle, 
00080 // since there are motions already stored in the buffer. However, this 'lag' should not
00081 // be an issue, since these commands are not typically used during a cycle.
00082 uint8_t system_execute_line(char *line) 
00083 {   
00084   uint8_t char_counter = 1; 
00085   uint8_t helper_var = 0; // Helper variable
00086   float parameter, value;
00087   switch( line[char_counter] ) {
00088     case 0 : report_grbl_help(); break;
00089     case 'G' : // Prints gcode parser state
00090       if ( line[++char_counter] != 0 ) { return(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT); }
00091       else { report_gcode_modes(); }
00092       break;   
00093     case 'C' : // Set check g-code mode [IDLE/CHECK]
00094       if ( line[++char_counter] != 0 ) { return(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT); }
00095       // Perform reset when toggling off. Check g-code mode should only work if Grbl
00096       // is idle and ready, regardless of alarm locks. This is mainly to keep things
00097       // simple and consistent.
00098       if ( sys.state == STATE_CHECK_MODE ) { 
00099         mc_reset(); 
00100         report_feedback_message(MESSAGE_DISABLED);
00101       } else {
00102         if (sys.state) { return(STATUS_IDLE_ERROR); } // Requires no alarm mode.
00103         sys.state = STATE_CHECK_MODE;
00104         report_feedback_message(MESSAGE_ENABLED);
00105       }
00106       break; 
00107     case 'X' : // Disable alarm lock [ALARM]
00108       if ( line[++char_counter] != 0 ) { return(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT); }
00109       if (sys.state == STATE_ALARM) { 
00110         report_feedback_message(MESSAGE_ALARM_UNLOCK);
00111         sys.state = STATE_IDLE;
00112         // Don't run startup script. Prevents stored moves in startup from causing accidents.
00113       } // Otherwise, no effect.
00114       break;               
00115 //  case 'J' : break;  // Jogging methods
00116     // TODO: Here jogging can be placed for execution as a seperate subprogram. It does not need to be 
00117     // susceptible to other runtime commands except for e-stop. The jogging function is intended to
00118     // be a basic toggle on/off with controlled acceleration and deceleration to prevent skipped 
00119     // steps. The user would supply the desired feedrate, axis to move, and direction. Toggle on would
00120     // start motion and toggle off would initiate a deceleration to stop. One could 'feather' the
00121     // motion by repeatedly toggling to slow the motion to the desired location. Location data would 
00122     // need to be updated real-time and supplied to the user through status queries.
00123     //   More controlled exact motions can be taken care of by inputting G0 or G1 commands, which are 
00124     // handled by the planner. It would be possible for the jog subprogram to insert blocks into the
00125     // block buffer without having the planner plan them. It would need to manage de/ac-celerations 
00126     // on its own carefully. This approach could be effective and possibly size/memory efficient.        
00127     default : 
00128       // Block any system command that requires the state as IDLE/ALARM. (i.e. EEPROM, homing)
00129       if ( !(sys.state == STATE_IDLE || sys.state == STATE_ALARM) ) { return(STATUS_IDLE_ERROR); }
00130       switch( line[char_counter] ) {
00131         case '$' : // Prints Grbl settings [IDLE/ALARM]
00132           if ( line[++char_counter] != 0 ) { return(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT); }
00133           else { report_grbl_settings(); }
00134           break;
00135         case '#' : // Print Grbl NGC parameters
00136           if ( line[++char_counter] != 0 ) { return(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT); }
00137           else { report_ngc_parameters(); }
00138           break;          
00139         case 'H' : // Perform homing cycle [IDLE/ALARM]
00140           if (bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_HOMING_ENABLE)) { 
00141             // Only perform homing if Grbl is idle or lost.
00142             mc_homing_cycle(); 
00143             if (!sys.abort) { system_execute_startup(line); } // Execute startup scripts after successful homing.
00144           } else { return(STATUS_SETTING_DISABLED); }
00145           break;
00146         case 'I' : // Print or store build info. [IDLE/ALARM]
00147           if ( line[++char_counter] == 0 ) { 
00148             if (!(settings_read_build_info(line))) {
00149               report_status_message(STATUS_SETTING_READ_FAIL);
00150             } else {
00151               report_build_info(line);
00152             }
00153           } else { // Store startup line [IDLE/ALARM]
00154             if(line[char_counter++] != '=') { return(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT); }
00155             helper_var = char_counter; // Set helper variable as counter to start of user info line.
00156             do {
00157               line[char_counter-helper_var] = line[char_counter];
00158             } while (line[char_counter++] != 0);
00159             settings_store_build_info(line);
00160           }
00161           break;                 
00162         case 'N' : // Startup lines. [IDLE/ALARM]
00163           if ( line[++char_counter] == 0 ) { // Print startup lines
00164             for (helper_var=0; helper_var < N_STARTUP_LINE; helper_var++) {
00165               if (!(settings_read_startup_line(helper_var, line))) {
00166                 report_status_message(STATUS_SETTING_READ_FAIL);
00167               } else {
00168                 report_startup_line(helper_var,line);
00169               }
00170             }
00171             break;
00172           } else { // Store startup line [IDLE Only] Prevents motion during ALARM.
00173             if (sys.state != STATE_IDLE) { return(STATUS_IDLE_ERROR); } // Store only when idle.
00174             helper_var = true;  // Set helper_var to flag storing method. 
00175             // No break. Continues into default: to read remaining command characters.
00176           }
00177         default :  // Storing setting methods [IDLE/ALARM]
00178           if(!read_float(line, &char_counter, &parameter)) { return(STATUS_BAD_NUMBER_FORMAT); }
00179           if(line[char_counter++] != '=') { return(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT); }
00180           if (helper_var) { // Store startup line
00181             // Prepare sending gcode block to gcode parser by shifting all characters
00182             helper_var = char_counter; // Set helper variable as counter to start of gcode block
00183             do {
00184               line[char_counter-helper_var] = line[char_counter];
00185             } while (line[char_counter++] != 0);
00186             // Execute gcode block to ensure block is valid.
00187             helper_var = gc_execute_line(line); // Set helper_var to returned status code.
00188             if (helper_var) { return(helper_var); }
00189             else { 
00190               helper_var = trunc(parameter); // Set helper_var to int value of parameter
00191               settings_store_startup_line(helper_var,line);
00192             }
00193           } else { // Store global setting.
00194             if(!read_float(line, &char_counter, &value)) { return(STATUS_BAD_NUMBER_FORMAT); }
00195             if(line[char_counter] != 0) { return(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT); }
00196             return(settings_store_global_setting(parameter, value));
00197           }
00198       }    
00199   }
00200   return(STATUS_OK); // If '$' command makes it to here, then everything's ok.
00201 }
